1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:39): Oh, right, I was waiting for some feedback from fantasai for some wording in the opening paragraphs for that property.  Shrug, I'll handle that later.  Committing change now.
c732fc81be22dc623a683815a8c930c0 (17:51): I remember hearing a rumor that the css validator was being updated to handle vendor prefixes. is this true?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:51): you know, assertions of unanimity of opinion/outrage about a particular issue within a particular community are often complete bullshit
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:51): just sayin'
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:51): I heard this from Jens.

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:53): people who disagree with the moral majority are unfortunately too unwilling to actually speak out and say that they don't really care about whatever hobbyhorse issue somebody is claiming to lobby for on behalf of some particular "community"
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (17:54): I am willing to speak out and say that I don't care how code points are formatted
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:54): or even that they actually completely disagree
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:54): or don't care either way
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:55): "the sky is falling" rhetoric, in general, is just really stupis
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:55): *stupid
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (17:55): What's the issue of the day?
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:55): I wonder when they are going to understand that expressions of outrage, no matter how heartfelt, do not make for convincing arguments
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:56): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: no comment
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:57): "I am outraged about this, and I will do everything I can to make others outraged about it. Therefore, do what I say."
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (17:57): ‚Ä¶or else

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (17:59): Yeah, like there's all these people protesting about something or other in the Middle East, while the majority of people who don't care and just want to get on with their lives are being ignored

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:00): you can pretty much guarantee that when somebody tells you, "Community X is going to be outraged if you do this.", what they really mean is, "I will actively attempt to whip Community X into a frenzy if you don't do what I am demanding."
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:01): anyway, I guess I should shut up now

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:05): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: I take it that you don't subscribe to the view that the grass-roots "pro-democracy" events in north africa are necessarily going to results in a rosier future for the people there?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (18:06): I think ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c subscribes to the view that the grass is always deviler on the advocate's side.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:06): again, I guess I should shut up
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:08): beautiful
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (18:08): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: you should write for Poetry Magazine
